did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: James City County (Va.) Public Buildings and Grounds, 1925-1989
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: James City County (Va.) Public Buildings and Grounds, 1925-1989. Local government records collection, James City County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, James City County, VA 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court records from James City County under accession numbers 52038 and 53845.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Greg Crawford, 2017. Updated by Vincent T. Brooks, 2023.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: James City County was named for King James I. It was one of the eight shires, or counties, enumerated in 1634. Subsequent additions from the Williamsburg section of York County were made in 1769, 1852, and 1880. The county courthouse is the city of Williamsburg, and the county administrative offices are near Kingsmill in the county.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: James City County (Va) Public Buildings and Grounds, 1925-1989, consists of two oversize boxes. Box 01 contains architectural drawings and plans for alterations to the James City County/Williamsburg Courthouse on Francis Street, as well as plats for the courthouse property, 1925-1967. Box 02 contains drawings for the demolished James City County Administration Building and demolished Mosquito Control Operations Building, 1973-1988. Also included in Box 02 are architectural drawings for alterations to the James City County/Williamsburg Courthouse on Monticello Avenue, 1989.
